snippet: Although a guest of a tenant is accused of setting a 2010 fire in Bensonhurst, the landlords knew that the building had been illegally subdivided and shared blame for the deaths, prosecutors said.
abstract: Vasilios Gerazounis and his son Agryrios Gerazounis, landlords of an illegally subdivided apartment building in Brooklyn where five Guatemalan immigrants died in a 2010 fire, are arraigned on manslaughter charges; guest of a tenant is accused of setting the blaze, but Brooklyn District Attorney Charles J Hynes says that the landlords knew of the subdivisions that blocked blocked tenants' ability to escape.

byline.original: By ANDY NEWMAN and MOSI SECRET

lead_paragraph: Although a guest of a tenant is accused of setting a 2010 fire in Bensonhurst, the landlords knew that the building had been illegally subdivided and shared blame for the deaths, prosecutors said.

headline.seo: Manslaughter Charges for Landlords in Brooklyn Fire That Killed 5
headline.main: Manslaughter Charges for Landlords in Brooklyn Fire That Killed 5
headline.print_headline: Manslaughter Charges for Landlords in Brooklyn Fire That Killed 5
